pullrequest.title: Added GUI configuration via INI file

content.raw:
It's a combination of the time panel, and the two side panels. The side panels have a minimum width, which is enforced by QT even when collapsed. This guarantees that the panels can always be displayed when opened. Without this minimum width the panels are very ugly, and we'd have to force the window larger when opened. 

We could take a few approaches:

1. Use a scroll area for the timepanel. This is the easiest

1. Force the "JointControl" tab closed if there is not enough room.

1. Make the "JointControl" tab behave like a slide-out overlay.
